title: Tabular values of a function based on derivatives

content.question: Let F be a function defined for all real numbers x such that <math> <mrow> <msup> <mi>F</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>></mo> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> </math> and <math> <mrow> <msup> <mi>F</mi> <mo>″</mo> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>></mo> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> </math>. Which of the following could be a table of values for F ?

choices.label: The figure shows a table with 5 rows and 2 columns. Row 1 is labeled x, row 2 is labeled 1, row 3 is labeled 2,row 4 is labeled 3, row 5 is labeled 4. Moving through the two columns that contain data from left to right, the data are as follows: Column 1: x, 1, 2, 3, 4 Colunm 2: F(x), -3, -4,-6,-9

The figure shows a table with 5 rows and 2 columns. Row 1 is labeled x, row 2 is labeled 1, row 3 is labeled 2,row 4 is labeled 3, row 5 is labeled 4. Moving through the two columns that contain data from left to right, the data are as follows: Column 1: x, 1, 2, 3, 4 Colunm 2: F(x), -3, -1,3,19

The figure shows a table with 5 rows and 2 columns. Row 1 is labeled x, row 2 is labeled 1, row 3 is labeled 2,row 4 is labeled 3, row 5 is labeled 4. Moving through the two columns that contain data from left to right, the data are as follows: Column 1: x, 1, 2, 3, 4 Colunm 2: F(x), -3, 0,3,6

The figure shows a table with 5 rows and 2 columns. Row 1 is labeled x, row 2 is labeled 1, row 3 is labeled 2,row 4 is labeled 3, row 5 is labeled 4. Moving through the two columns that contain data from left to right, the data are as follows: Column 1: x, 1, 2, 3, 4 Colunm 2: F(x), -3, 5,11,13

The figure shows a table with 5 rows and 2 columns. Row 1 is labeled x, row 2 is labeled 1, row 3 is labeled 2,row 4 is labeled 3, row 5 is labeled 4. Moving through the two columns that contain data from left to right, the data are as follows: Column 1: x, 1, 2, 3, 4 Colunm 2: F(x), -3, -4,-3,0

content.answer: The figure shows a table with 5 rows and 2 columns. Row 1 is labeled x, row 2 is labeled 1, row 3 is labeled 2,row 4 is labeled 3, row 5 is labeled 4. Moving through the two columns that contain data from left to right, the data are as follows: Column 1: x, 1, 2, 3, 4 Colunm 2: F(x), -3, -1,3,19

topic.text: 5.9: Connecting a Function, Its First Derivative, and Its Second Derivative

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
